src_text: oma ga mebasepala mo go laedit ego go kaonafalo mo go swanago ka makaleng ao a nyakilego go ba ka moka a dipoelo t a tlhaki o ya dipuku t a dit helete t a mebasepal Dihlongwa t e nt i t e di ka bago t e 96% (mebasepala le ditheo t a mebasepala) di romet e ditatamente t a t ona t a dit helete ka nako, e lego kaonafalo ye kgolo go tloga go 93% ka 2012/13 le 78% ka 2007/08.Pego e lemoga gore go dirilwe maitekelo ao a tsenelet ego go rarolla t homi o ya dit helete ye e sego molaon Seo se lemogwago ke koket ego ye kgolo ka go palo ya mebasepala le ka go ditheo t a mebasepala yeo e hwedit wego dipoelo t a tlhaki o ya dipuku t a dit helete ye e kgahli ago go tloga go ye 30 ka 2012/13 go fihla go ye 58 ka 2013/14, gomme ke fela ye
trg_text: Cabinet welcomes the 2013-2014 Local Government Audit Outcomes and applauds the performance of municipalities that showed a consistent improvement in almost all aspects of municipal-audit outcome An overwhelming 96% of auditees (municipalities and municipal entities) submitted their financial statements on time, which is a major improvement from 93% in 2012/13 and 78% in 2007/08.The report recognises that a concerted effort was made to address irregular expenditur Notable is the significant increase in the number of municipalities and municipal entities with unqualified audits from 30 in 2012/13 to 58 in 2013/14, with only seven in 2007/08 pointing to a steady trend towards good governance and sound financial managemenAuditees with financially unqualified opinions now account for 76% of the total local government expenditure budget of R315 billio This means that almost eight out of every 10 rand spent by local government is spent by entities with financially unqualified statementOf the 335 municipalities and entities audited, 102 improved, 194 remained constant, 27 regressed while two were new and 10 were still outstandin This reinforces more efficient and accountable basic service delivery in line with the

trg_text: Cabinet affirms its confidence in the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA) to effectively execute its duties as mandated by our Constitution despite the recent change in its leadershiThe NPA remains steadfast in its work, and has the relevant structures and systems in place to continue to promote a crime-free societ In 2014 the organisation improved its conviction rate at all court levels with 9per cent (273 641 cases) at district courts, 76 per cent (27 246 cases) at regional courts and 88 per cent (911 cases) at all high court

src_text: upa gape ditsenogare t e bohlokwa t a togamaano ka nepo ya go bu et a sehlongwa se seken Mokgwa o moswa wa kgwebo o a hlangwa go fokot a go bota go feti i a kgwebong ya go romela mangwalo le go leba go mokgwa wa go tsenya letseno wo o kopant weg Kabinete e na le boitshepho bja gore leano le tla t wet a pele SAP Tona ya Kgoro ya Mananeokgoparara a Dikgokagano le Ditirelo t a Poso, gammogo le ba taolo ya SAPO, ba tla swara kopano ya go sedimo a baga i ba ditaba go hlalo a leano le ka bophar Kabinete e dumet e gore poelo ye e amoget wego mabapi le pego ya mathomong Afrika Borwa ya phethagat o ya T hata ya Afrika ka ga Ditokelo le Bophelo bjo bokaone bja Bana (2000-2013), e alwe ka Palamenten Pego ye e amoget we go t wa go Komiti ya Ditsebi t a Afrika ka ga Ditokelo le Bophelo bjo Bokaone bja Ban Kabinete e thekgile mekgwa ya pu o ya go netefat a gore go ba le mokgwa wo o kopant wego, wa go tlemaganywa le wa go kgatha tema go phethagat o ya T hata ya Afrika ka ga Ditokelo le Bophelo bjo bokaone bja Bana go obamela ditokelo t a molaotheo t a banGo romelwa ga pego ye ya Afrika Borwa go sepelelana le melao le ditlamego t a tumelelano ya bodit habat hab Pego ye e
trg_text: Cabinet approved that the feedback received on South Africa s initial report on the implementation of the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child (2000-2013), be tabled in Parliamen This report was received from the African Committee of Experts on the Rights and Welfare of the Chil Cabinet endorsed the governance mechanisms to ensure an integrated, coherent and participatory approach to the implementation of the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child in compliance to the constitutional rights of childreSubmission of South Africa s report is in line with international treaty laws and obligation This report also serves as a barometer on how the nation is progressing on upholding children s rights and well-being

src_text: oma gape bjalo ka selo seo se elago ka fao set haba se gatelago pele ka gona go phethagat a ditokelo t a bana le go phela gabotse ga bona Maemo a Kabinete ka go Merero ye e lego Ditabeng Seemong sa Bjale Kabinete e reta go swarwa ka katlego ga Seboka sa Ekonomi ya Lefase (WEF) ka Afrika ka Motsekapa bekeng ye e fetilego, yeo e tii et ago leswa gore naga ye ke lefelo la boeti la maemo a godimo lefaseng fao go swarwago ditiragalo t a maemo a godim WEF Africa e file sefala sa gore mmu o o bont he Afrika Borwa bjalo ka lefelo leo le ka etelwago la dipeelet o le la kgwebo, e lego selo se bohlokwa go fihlelela maikemi et o a Leanotlhabollo la Boset haba (NDP).Kabinete e amogela gape tema ye bohlokwa ye e kgathilwego ke ba lefapha la kga o go netefat a gore tshedimo o go t wa mo tiragalong ye ye bohlokwa e ga wa ka makaleng a kga o a mehutahuta go dumelela gore ditaba di fihle go maAfrika BorwKelo ya sekoloto ya Afrika Borwa ka BBB ye e dirilwego ke Fitch Ratings e tii et a leswa gore naga ye e dula e bulet e peelet o ye e t wago dinageng t a ka ntle ebile e t wela pele go laet a boikgafo bja mmu o go taolo ya dit helete ye e nago le tlhokomel Le ge go le bjale, mathata ao a t weledit wego ke Fitch a hwet a
trg_text: Celebrating 20 Years of South Africa s Media, which captures various aspects of the inspiring past 21 years in which media have played a critical rol Each chapter considers the media landscape from 1994 and reflects on how far we have come, while considering future challenge Most of the stakeholders agree that much has been achieved in this disciplinCabinet urges those in the media, academia, civil society and government to read Media Landscape 2014, which provokes informed debate and discussion on the 20 years of the media in a democratic South Afric The publication offers an objective and honest account of the country s media secto In the drafting process it fostered strong collaboration between government and the media industry, through leaders and civil society organisation

src_text: Re Keteka Mengwaga ye 20 ya Kga o ya Afrika Borwa, yeo e akaret ago dilo t a mehutahuta t a mengwaga ye e fetilego ye 21 ye e bego e hlohlelet a yeo ka go yona kga o e ralokilego tema ye bohlokw Kgaolo ye nngwe le ye nngwe e hlokomet e karolo ya kga o go thoma ka 1994 ebile e laet a gore re t wa kgole bjang, mola ka go le lengwe e hlokomet e ditlhohlo t a ka mos Bont i bja bakgathatema ba dumela gore go fihlelet we dilo t e nt i ka mo lefapheng lKabinete e ipilet a go bao ba lego ka go kga o, dirutegi, set haba sa badudi le mmu o go bala kgati o ya Media Landscape 2014, yeo e hlohlago dingangi ano t e di nago le tsebo le dipoledi ano ka ga mengwaga ye 20 ya kga o ka go Afrika Borwa ya temokras Kgati o ye e fa pego ye e sa t eego lehlakore le ya botshepegi ya lefapha la kga o ka mo nagen Ge e be e sa thalwa e diri it e tiri ano ye maatla magareng ga mmu o le intasteri ya kga o, ka go
trg_text: Cabinet was appraised with the implementation of the recent immigration legislation amendments and the immigration regulations of 2014, including the requirements for travelling with children through South Africa s ports of entry, which came into operation on 1 June 2015.Cabinet has however noted the views expressed by various sector In order to hear these views, Cabinet has resolved to set up a team of Ministers from both the economic and security cluster The team is expected to discuss and engage with the concerns with the aim of finding ways to address the unintended consequences brought about by the implementation of this regulation This team will be convened by Minister Malusi Gigab In addition, the Inter-Ministerial Committee on Migration will also continue with its work to relook at all the aspects relating to migrants that are in the countr This work will assist to provide synergy between migration and our laws

src_text: omi a baetapele le mekgatlo ya set hab Kabinete e tii et a boitshepo bja yona go Bolaodi bja Boseki i ya Boset haba (NPA) go phethagat a me omo ya yona ka bokgoni ka ge e filwe mo omo wo ke Molaotheo go sa lebelelwe phetogo ye e sa t wago dirwa ka go bolaodi bja yonNPA e t wela pele go tia ka mo omong wa yona, ebile e na le makala le ditshepedi o t a maleba go t wela pele go t wet a pele set haba seo se hlokago boseny Ka 2014 setheo se se kaonafadit e kelo ya sona ya go bona basenyi molato ka maemong ka moka a dikgorotsheko ka 9 (melato ye 273 641) ka go dikgorotsheko t a didiko, 76% (melato ye 27 246) ka go dikgorotsheko t a dilete le 88% (melato ye 911) ka go dikgorotsheko t a godimo ka mok Kabinete e amogela go lokollwa ga Dinyaki i o t a mathomo ka ga Bogoboga t a Afrika Borwa t eo di lebelet ego kudu maikutlo a batho mabapi le HIV le AIDS le TB ka Khonferentsheng ya bo 7 ka ga AIDS ya Afrika Borwa, yeo e lego gare mo lebakeng le ka Durba Dinyaki i o t a Bogoboga, e lego t e kgolokgolo lefaseng, di fa ditiro t e di bonagalago le t a boithomelo le mananeo a go lwant ha bogoboga le kgetholo ya batho bao ba phelago ka HIV le T Kabinete e amoget e katlego ya Beke ya T hirelet o ya Bana (CPW) gomme e bu elet a gore bana ba rena ke motheo wa bokamoso bja naga ya rena gomme e ipilet a go dit haba go ba

trg_text: Cabinet calls on all South Africans to join government on World Refugee Day, 20 June 2015, in reaffirming the country s international commitment to treat all refugees with dignit As a signatory to the 1951 Geneva Refugee Convention and as a country that cherishes human rights, we have an obligation to protect the basic rights of refugees within our border In many instances these are vulnerable men, women and children who have been forced to flee their homelands and have done so with great courage, strength and determinatio

src_text: oma ka la 1 Phupu 2015.Le ge go le bjale Kabinete e t eet e tlhogong maikutlo go t wa ka makaleng a mehutahut Ka nepo ya go kwa maikutlo a, Kabinete e t ere sephetho sa go hloma sehlopha sa Ditona go t wa ka mafapheng a ekonomi le t hirelet Sehlopha se go emet we gore se tla ahlaahla le go reri ana le bao ba nago le dingongorego ka maikemi et o a go hwet a mekgwa ya go rarolla dipoelo t eo di bego di se t a letelwa t e di tli it wego ke go phethagat a melao y Sehlopha se se tla kgokaganywa ke Tona Malusi GigabGodimo ga fao, Komiti ya Ditona t a Dikgoro t e di Fapafapanego ka ga Bofaladi le yona e tla t wela pele ka mo omo wa yona go lebelela leswa dilo ka moka t e di amanago le bafaladi bao ba lego ka nagen Mo omo wo o tla thu a go fa kamano magareng ga bofaladi le melao ya rena Ditiragalo t e di Tlago Mopresidente Jacob Zuma o tla tsenela meketeko ya Let at i la Bafsa ka la 16 Phupu 2015 ka Tshwane Events Centre, ka Gauteng ka fase ga morero wa:
trg_text: The 60th anniversary of the Freedom Charter, which will be marked on 26 June 2015, will be used to demonstrate progress made towards realising its ideals, and to show alignment between government policies and this historic documen The Freedom Charter is a foundation on which our world acclaimed Constitution is based; today it gives effect to the country we are building through our policies and programmes
